summary: This bill, the Indoor Air Quality and Healthy Schools Act of 2025, establishes a national program to reduce human exposure to indoor air contaminants. The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is tasked with various responsibilities, including research, guidelines for contaminants of concern (including concentration limits), technical assistance, voluntary building certifications, model building provisions, and a national assessment of indoor air quality in schools and childcare facilities. The bill also provides for grants to support these initiatives and authorizes appropriations for implementation.
